snippet: President Aleksandr Z. Ankvab, whose popularity had plummeted amid deteriorating economic conditions, stepped down as the leader of Abkhazia, a breakaway region of Georgia.
abstract: Aleksandr Z Ankvab, president of Abkhazia, breakaway region of Georgia heavily supported by Russia, resigns following week of unrest during which demonstrators stormed presidential administration building; Parliament had voted to oust Ankvab, whose popularity had plummeted amid deteriorating economic conditions, scheduling early presidential election for August.
lead_paragraph: President Aleksandr Z. Ankvab, whose popularity had plummeted amid deteriorating economic conditions, stepped down as the leader of Abkhazia, a breakaway region of Georgia.

headline.main: President of Georgian Abkhazia Resigns Under Pressure
headline.print_headline: President of Georgian Abkhazia Resigns Under Pressure
